default: (a) an {@item explorer's pack|PHB|} or (b) a {@item soldier's pack|TPVang}

classFeature.name: Shield-Bearer
entries: You prioritize protection above all else, specializing in defensive combat with shields.

entries.name: Dual-Shields
entries: You can benefit from wielding two {@item shield|PHB|shields} at the same time. If you do, the AC bonus of the second shield is halved, and you can use a bonus action on your turn to try and shove a creature.

entries.name: Towershield
entries: While you are wielding a {@item towershield|TPVang}, you can use a bonus action to take on a wide stance, providing half cover to creatures of your choice within 5 feet of you until the start of your next turn or until you doff the shield.

classFeature.name: Guard
entries: In battle, you stand guard over your allies, ready to be their aegis. If you take the {@action Ready} action to move up to your speed, you can try to {@action shove} a creature during the same reaction.
Additionally, if a creature provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can try to {@action shove} it instead.

classFeature.name: Fortitude
entries: While wearing {@filter heavy armor|items|type=heavy armor}, you are a walking bastion of unbreakable poise, granting you the following benefits:

items: Any bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage you take is reduced by an amount equal to half your vanguard level.

You count as being one size larger (minimum Large) when making Strength-based ability checks and Strength saving throws. You also have advantage on Strength checks you make against Medium and smaller targets.
If you succeed in shoving a target that is your size or smaller, you can push it up to 10 feet away from you, or push the target up to 5 feet away from you and knock it {@condition prone}.

entries: This restriction is not intended to punish traits that restrict characters from heavy armor, such as Shell Defense. Allow these players to choose if the trait counts as heavy armor for the purpose of this feature.

classFeature.name: Rampant Charge
entries: You can throw caution to the wind to break enemy lines. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line, you can choose to charge in a straight line for the rest of the move. If you move into the space of another creature during the charge, you can try to shove it. If you successfully shove it, you push it ahead of you for the rest of your move.

The charge ends early if you lose a contest to shove a creature or if you push a creature into a structure. Any creatures pushed into a structure take bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Strength modifier.
When you charge, attack rolls against you have advantage until the start of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Vanguardian Mandate
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a mandate that embodies the tactics you employ in defending others. Your choice grants you features at 3rd, 6th, 10th, and 14th levels

classFeature.name: Lock Down
entries: If you successfully shove a creature, you can choose to reduce its speed to 0 until the end of the current turn, rather than push it or knock it {@condition prone}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Bolstered Vitality
entries: When you finish a long rest, you regain all of your Hit Dice rather than half.

classFeature.name: Ever Ready
entries: While you're not {@condition incapacitated} or surprised, no effect can prevent you from using your reaction, and you can take up to two reactions per round, but only one per turn. This second reaction can be used to move up to your speed and potentially try to shove a creature if you took the Ready action during your last turn, in addition to the reactions you can normally take.

classFeature.name: Vanguardian Mandate feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain one feature granted by your Vanguardian Mandate.

classFeature.name: Stalwart Vigilance
entries: You have a heightened awareness for threats that grants you advantage on initiative rolls and a +5 bonus to your passive Perception while you're not {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition incapacitated}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Fearless
entries: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or end being {@condition frightened}, and you can't be {@condition frightened} by any creature whose Strength score is lower than yours.

classFeature.name: Tireless
entries: As an action, you can give yourself a number of temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). You can use this action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
In addition, whenever you finish a short rest, your {@condition exhaustion} level, if any, is decreased by 1.

classFeature.name: Vanguardian Mandate feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain one feature granted by your Vanguardian Mandate.

classFeature.name: Muster for Battle
entries: You can take the {@action Ready} action when you roll initiative (no action required).

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Power Through
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that you can see that requires you to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your Constitution modifier in place of your Dexterity modifier if you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.
Further, when you succeed on a saving throw against an effect that deals damage, you reduce the damage you take from the effect by half.

classFeature.name: Vanguardian Mandate feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain one feature granted by your Vanguardian Mandate.

classFeature.name: Behemoth Might
entries: You count as being two size larger (minimum Huge) when making Strength-based ability checks and Strength saving throws. You also have advantage on Strength checks you make against Large and smaller targets.
Additionally, you ignore the two-handed property of {@item towershield|TPVang|towershields}.
Two instances of half cover do not stack or provide additional cover.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Force of Will
entries: If you try to shove a creature and lose the contest, you can choose to shove it as if you had won.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Towering Colossus
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 4. Your maximum for that score is now 24.
Additionally, while your feet are firmly planted on the ground, you can't be moved or teleported against your will by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Indestructible
entries: While wearing heavy armor, you are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by other creatures (their attacks, spells, and other effects) that does not kill you outright.

subclassFeature.name: Ardent
entries: An ardent's passion for sheltering others from harm manifests in them as a psychic power. This awakening allows them to project stationary barriers of psychic energy and launch enemies with telekinetic force.

subclassFeature.name: Ardent Psionics
entries: Unlike other psionic archetypes, you tap into your inner reserves to manifest the psionic powers you have, which are detailed below.

You can manifest your psionic powers a number of times equal to twice your proficiency bonus, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest. Some of your powers expend Hit Dice, specified in the power's description, and you can't use a power if it requires you to use Hit Dice when your Hit Dice are all expended.

entries.name: Aegis Projection
entries: As a bonus action, you can spend your Hit Dice to manifest a 10-foot radius immobile barrier of shimmering force for 1 minute. The barrier has AC 10, hit points equal to 10 x the number of Hit Dice you spend, and immunity to poison damage. Creatures can move through the barrier, and any creature within it gains total cover from the barrier. The barrier disappears immediately if it is reduced to 0 hit points or you use this power again.

entries.name: Aegis Projection
entries: When you successfully shove a creature and push it, you can focus your psychic power and push it an additional 10 feet. If a creature is standing on top of a shield you are wielding, you can use this power to safely boost the creature's jump height by 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Mental Tower
entries: You and any allies within 10 feet of you gain a bonus to saving throws made to avoid or end the effects of divination spells and the {@condition charmed} condition. This bonus is equal to half your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Focused Beneficence
entries: You are awoken to new psionic powers you can manifest with {@subclassFeature Ardent Psionics|Vanguard|TPVang|Ardent|TPVang|3}:

entries.name: Mind Snap
entries: You can launch a psychic assault against a creature. As an action, you can choose a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see. For the next minute, whenever the creature is in the process of casting a spell, you can use your reaction and spend one of your Hit Dice to force it to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failure, the spell fails.

entries.name: Psychic Redirection
entries: When a ranged attack is made against a creature within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to psionically intercede on the attack. Roll a {@dice d12} and reduce the attack roll by that amount. If the attack roll is reduced to 0, you can redirect the attack to another creature within 30 feet of you, using the original attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Sixth Sense
entries: You gain a measure of telepathy that alerts you to the thoughts of others. You are aware of the location of any creature within 10 feet of you that is not protected from divination magic and is capable of thought (DM's discretion). You see {@condition invisible} creatures within 10 feet of you that you are aware of as if they were visible.

subclassFeature.name: Schistic Mind
entries: You are immune to psychic damage, the {@condition charmed} condition, and any divination spells or effects that would sense your emotions or read your thoughts

Further, the distance of your {@subclassFeature Mental Tower|Vanguard|TPVang|Ardent|TPVang|3} and {@subclassFeature Sixth Sense|Vanguard|TPVang|Ardent|TPVang|10} features extend to 30 feet, rather than 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Dreadlord
entries: Feeling a duty of pain, dreadlords are typically conscripted warriors, given fel power straight from a fiend's armory. A dreadlord draws upon this power to punish those that dare draw their blades on them, a punishment they delight in coercing their enemies to inflict upon themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Sightless Watcher
entries: You learn to read, speak, and write Infernal and Abyssal.
Additionally, you can see in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, out to a range of 30 feet, increasing to 60 feet when you reach 11th level.

subclassFeature.name: Wrathchild
entries: If a creature misses you with an attack roll, you can allow the attack to hit (no action required). If you do, the attacker takes psychic damage equal to your Constitution modifier + half your vanguard level, and you can spend one of your vanguard Hit Dice to curse it until you curse another creature or die.

While cursed, the creature's eyes become clouded. At the start of each of the creature's turns, it must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failure, this clouding becomes magical darkness that {@condition blinded|PHB|blinds} the creature while trying to perceive any creature other than its allies or you until the start of its next turn.
You can curse a creature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Betrayer's Blessing
entries: When you curse a target with {@subclassFeature Wrathchild|Vanguard|TPVang|Dreadlord|TPVang|3}, you can use your reaction to gain {@dice 1d12} temporary hit points and resistance to the next instance of damage you take in the next minute.

subclassFeature.name: Grasp of Treachery
entries: When you curse a target with {@subclassFeature Wrathchild|Vanguard|TPVang|Dreadlord|TPVang|3}, you can choose a different hostile creature that you can see within 30 feet of the attacker, extending a compulsion of betrayal. If the cursed creature fails its Wisdom saving throw at the start of its turn, the chosen hostile creature must use its reaction to make an attack against the cursed creature.

subclassFeature.name: Into the Void
entries: When a creature attacks you or deals damage to you, you can force it to make a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failure, the creature is presented to you to answer for its transgressions, depending on its distance from you:

items: If the creature is within 60 feet of you, it is pulled toward you, arriving in the nearest unoccupied space to you. If the pulled creature impacts any other creatures that are its size or smaller, they must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled as well. If a pulled creature impacts an object, it takes {@dice 1d10} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was pulled and is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

If the creature is further than 60 feet from you, but on the same plane of existence, it takes {@dice 3d8} + your Constitution modifier psychic damage and is teleported to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. A creature on a different plane of existence takes this damage, but is not teleported.

entries: Once a creature fails its saving throw against this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest

subclassFeature.name: Juggernaut
entries: While almost more of a compulsion rather than a duty, the juggernaut is a vanguard with a drive for havoc.

subclassFeature.name: Hulking Endurance
entries: When you take damage, you can use a reaction and spend one of your vanguard Hit Dice to reduce the damage taken by an amount equal to {@dice 1d12} + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Unstoppable Force
entries: When you use {@classFeature Rampant Charge|Vanguard|TPVang|2}, the bludgeoning damage you deal by pushing a creature into a structure increases to {@dice 2d8} + your Strength modifier. Additionally, the first time on a turn that you charge into a nonmagical object or structure with an AC 17 or lower and that is no thicker than 1-foot, you can break through it rather than end the charge.
Essentially any material that is weaker than metal.

subclassFeature.name: Disrespect Your Surroundings
entries: You deal double damage to objects and structures, and any creature you force to move by physical means provokes opportunity attacks from creatures other than you. If a creature is hit with an opportunity attack this way that scores a critical hit, the attack deals an additional die of damage.

subclassFeature.name: Shake it Off
entries: When you use {@subclassFeature Hulking Endurance|Vanguard|TPVang|Juggernaut|TPVang|3}, you roll an additional {@dice d12} when determining the amount of damage you reduce, for a total of {@dice 2d12} + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Supernaut
entries: While you are charging, you can break through objects and structures with an AC 20 or lower and the damage you deal by pushing a creature into a structure increases to {@dice 2d10} + your Strength modifier.
Further, you can reduce damage you take during your turn with your {@subclassFeature Hulking Endurance|Vanguard|TPVang|Juggernaut|TPVang|3} feature (no reaction required).

subclassFeature.name: Rimeguard
entries: Defenders of frostbound kingdoms, standing strong in the bite of winter, Rimeguards are vanguards that embody the terrifying borea. Vanguards under this mandate may model themselves after frost giants, be within the ranks of a white dragon's military, or have been raised for service by a bheur hag. Their bond to the cold doesn't necessarily grant them access to spells, despite likely haven taken in some boreal ritual to harness their powers.

subclassFeature.name: Frostbound
entries: You have resistance to cold damage, and your movement and vision are unaffected by snow and ice.

Further, while you are in an environment of extreme cold, you regain 1 of your spent Hit Dice per hour spent in the cold, and you can complete a long rest in 4 hours if you spend that time doing nothing but light activity.

subclassFeature.name: Glacial Bastion
entries: When you take the {@action Ready} action on your turn, you can spend one of your Hit Dice to conjure a wall of ice in an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of you for 1 minute, or until you dismiss any of your conjured ice walls as a bonus action. The wall is 10 feet tall, 5 feet wide, and 1 foot thick. It has AC 8, 10 hit points, is immune to psychic and poison damage, and is vulnerable to bludgeoning and fire damage.
If you use {@classFeature Rampant Charge|Vanguard|TPVang|2} to push a creature into the wall, the wall immediately shatters and deals an additional {@dice 1d6} cold damage to the pushed creature.

subclassFeature.name: Hyperborean Howl
entries: You can use a bonus action during your turn unleash gelid hell in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on you for 1 minute or until you dismiss it as a bonus action. The sphere moves with you, and the inside of the sphere is subjected to the following effects:

items: The area becomes an environment of extreme cold with gale-force winds and snowing precipitation.
The ground in the area becomes slick with ice and any free-standing fresh water freezes, both becoming icy difficult terrain.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Starting at 14th level, you can use it twice before a rest.

subclassFeature.name: Winter of Discontent
entries: The additional cold damage you deal when you push a creature into an ice wall you create with {@subclassFeature Glacial Bastion|Vanguard|TPVang|Rimeguard|TPVang|3} increases to {@dice 2d6}. This damage is increased to {@dice 4d6} in extreme cold.

subclassFeature.name: Everlasting One
entries: You reduce cold damage you take by an amount equal to half your vanguard level. Further, if you successfully shove a creature and reduce its speed to 0, it becomes frozen in place, {@condition restrained|PHB|restraining} it until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Templar
entries: While almost more of a compulsion rather than a duty, the Templar is a vanguard with a drive for havoc.

subclassFeature.name: Righteous Cause
entries: The gods have deemed your cause worthy, granting you the ability to manifest minor miracles. You learn the {@spell respite|TPVang} and {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrips. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for them.

subclassFeature.name: Venerated Martyr
entries: Your charge of selflessness is blessed by the gods, granting you the ability to bear the pain of others. If a creature within 20 feet of you that you can see is attacked or takes damage, you can spend one of your vanguard Hit Dice to take the damage instead (no action required). You can't use this feature if you are {@condition blinded} or {@condition incapacitated}, or surprised.
The damage you take in this way can't be reduced in any way except by the {@subclassFeature Divine Intercession|Vanguard|TPVang|Templar|TPVang|14} feature you gain at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Punishment Due
entries: When you use {@subclassFeature Venerated Martyr|Vanguard|TPVang|Templar|TPVang|3}, your body becomes basked in divine light, which sheds bright light out to 10 feet and dim light for an additional 10 feet for 1 minute. While basked in this energy, you can use your reaction when you take damage to cause this energy to erupt from you. When you do, roll every Hit Dice you spent in the last minute. Each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or take radiant damage equal to the result of the Hit Dice rolled and be {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this action, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Heart of Benevolence
entries: Creatures you take damage for with {@subclassFeature Venerated Martyr|Vanguard|TPVang|Templar|TPVang|3} gain the benefits of the {@spell sanctuary} spell until the end of your next turn
Further, if a spell, such as {@spell raise dead}, has the sole effect of restoring you to life (but not undeath), the caster doesn't need material components to cast the spell on you.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Intercession
entries: You can use your reaction at the end of any creature's turn to reduce all of the damage you took during the turn to 0.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Vexator
entries: While almost more of a compulsion rather than a duty, the Vexator is a vanguard with a drive for havoc.

subclassFeature.name: Braggadocious
entries: You gain proficiency with a skill of your choice from either {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Persuasion}, or {@skill Performance} and, whenever you make a Charisma check related to your fighting prowess or exerting physical dominance, you can replace your Charisma modifier with your Strength modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Taunt
entries: Your boisterous persona allows you to draw your enemies' aggression. As an action, you can make a Charisma check using a skill of the DM's choice (typically determined by the nature of your taunt) and force a creature of your choice within 30 feet of you that can comprehend your taunt to make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC equal to the result of your check. On a failed save, you provoke an opportunity attack from the target, and the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you for 1 minute. This effect ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated}, if you die, or if you move more than 30 feet away from the creature. The creature can attempt the saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
Once the effect ends or if the creature succeeds on the saving throw, the creature has advantage on Wisdom saving throws it makes against this effect until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Center of Attention
entries: When you use {@subclassFeature Taunt|Vanguard|TPVang|Vexator|TPVang|3}, you can target a number of creatures with it equal to your proficiency bonus. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dramatic Entrance
entries: You can use {@subclassFeature Taunt|Vanguard|TPVang|Vexator|TPVang|3} as a reaction to rolling initiative. If you target a creature with {@subclassFeature Taunt|Vanguard|TPVang|Vexator|TPVang|3} that hasn't taken a turn yet in the current combat, it has disadvantage on its Wisdom saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Cult of Personality
entries: While a creature is under the effects of your {@subclassFeature Taunt|Vanguard|TPVang|Vexator|TPVang|3}, it can't willingly move more than 30 feet away from you.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies:
entries: Choose two from among {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Investigation}

items.name: Languages:
entries: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment:
entries: A {@filter simple weapon|items|type=simple weapon;!renaissance;!modern;!futuristic;!treasure (gemstone);!treasure (art object);!treasure (coinage)|Cost=[&0;&1000]|miscellaneous=mundane} worth no more than 10 gp, a memento from a previous client, a set of manacles, a set of {@item common clothes|PHB}, and a {@item pouch|PHB} containing 10 gp

entries.name: Clientele
entries: It takes special training to protect special clients. Consider what types of clients you specialize in guarding and discuss with your DM if this grants you any other benefit. You can roll on the following table to determine your client specialty, or choose one that best fits your character.

entries.name: Feature: Got Your Back
entries: You gain a feat of your choice from either {@feat Alert}, {@feat Observant}, {@feat Sentinel}, or {@feat Shield Basher|TPVang}. In addition, those that you have previously worked for may help to cover your lifestyle expenses or get you access to certain events or people normally closed off to individuals outside of their circle.

entries.name: Building a Bodyguard Character
entries: Putting your life on the line for other people tends to shape your outlook and perspective on the world. The Bodyguard Personality Traits table suggests a variety of traits you might adopt for your character.

rows: I'd take a sword in the gut for any of my allies.
'm haunted by memories of a client dying under my watch.
I don't know when to turn 'protector mode' off.
My worry for others affects my self-care. Most notably my hygiene.
Alcohol? I never touch the stuff. Have to stay alert.
I've learned to sleep with one eye open. Gods, I'm tired.
I spent a lot of time learning not to react to things as other people do. It's my job. It doesn't always work.
I do this job because I love the life of luxury my clients provide.

feat.name: Bully
entries: You're content with picking on someone your own size, but little guys are just more convenient. You gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with improvised attacks you make with corpses and creatures.

You can use a Medium or Small creature you are grappling as both a {@item shield|PHB} and as an improvised weapon with the thrown property and a range of 20 feet. Attacks made with a creature this way deal {@dice 1d8} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage on a hit. If the creature you are using as a weapon  isn't a corpse, it takes this damage as well.
When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to cause a creature you are grappling to take the damage instead. You can't use this reaction if the creature is a corpse.

feat.name: Fencer

prerequisite.other: Dueling Fighting Style and proficiency with either a rapier, scimitar, shortsword, or longsword

entries: Deft at defensive swordplay, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with {@skill Acrobatics} and can use a bonus action on your turn to make an {@skill Acrobatics} check.

When a creature you can see makes a weapon attack against you while you are wielding a {@item rapier|PHB}, {@item scimitar|PHB}, {@item shortsword|PHB}, or {@item longsword|PHB} and no other weapons, you can use your reaction to make an attack roll with your weapon. If your attack roll is higher than the triggering attack, that attack misses and your attack hits the creature if it is within your reach.

feat.name: Shield Basher
entries: The best offense is a good defense, especially one that can inflict blunt-force trauma. You specialize in the use of shields as a weapon, granting you the following benefits:

items: When you make a melee attack with a shield, you can treat it as a simple melee weapon rather than an improvised weapon. Melee weapon attacks you make with shields deal {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage on a hit.
If you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make an attack with a shield as a bonus action.

spell.name: Respite
entries: You sacrifice your own vitality to heal another creature by spending and rolling one of your Hit Dice, restoring hit points to the creature equal to the result of the roll.

item.name: Towershield
entries: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.
The wearer has disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.
If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

entries.name: Special
entries: The towershield grants you half cover.

item.name: Soldier's Pack
entries: Includes:

items: a {@item backpack|phb}
a knife
warm clothes
a map
a {@item bedroll|PHB}
a {@item tinderbox|phb}
a {@item mess kit|phb}
a {@item shovel|phb}
10 days of dehydrated {@item Rations (1 day)|phb|rations}
a {@item waterskin|phb}

entries.name: Vanguard
entries: Screams echo across the cavern walls, as a valiant knight charges ahead towards the source of the anguish. His armor clatters loudly, alerting a group of firenewts to his front. He welcomes their attention like an old friend and readies his behemoth towershield, placing it between himself and the scouts. As the moving bastion is pelted with a volley of arrows, he feels his shield make contact with something soft. He turns sharply into one of the cavern walls and slams it with full force. The sickening crunch of broken bones and dripping viscera from under the shield confirms his kill, and he turns his ire towards the remaining scouts.
Vanguards are terrifying sentinels donned in heavy metal armor and towering shields to devastate their enemies.

entries.name: Dutiful Guardians
entries: Similar to a paladin taking an oath, a vanguard is sworn to a duty of protection called their "mandate." These stalwart protectors feel an obligation to defend their allies, wearing their battle scars as badges of honor that mark this courageous duty fulfilled.

entries.name: Playing a Vanguard
entries: The vanguard is a class for people that prefer a high control and defense character over raw damage output. This class forgoes conventional 'damage spikes' for 'defense spikes,' and grants you the ability to more actively tank by focusing on defending through the Ready action and shoving.
Action: Ready or Shove Attacks
Bonus Action: Bonus Action Shove
Movement: You should prioritize staying in the enemy's face as much as possible. The Ready action allows you to intercede when danger and harm occur, removing the need to predict it.
Reaction: Intercede on attacks, opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Creating a Vanguard
entries: To create a vanguard, consult the following subsections, which give you hit points, proficiencies, and starting equipment. Then look at the Vanguard table to see which features you get at each level. Your Proficiency Bonus is shown in the PB column. The descriptions of those features appear in the 'Class Features' section.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a Vanguard quickly by following these suggestions. First, Constitution should be your highest ability score, followed by Strength. Second, choose the {@background soldier|PHB} background.
